text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any
author: alice walker

text: you will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger
author: budha

text: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions.
author: Lord Krishna

text: In my walks, every man I meet is my superior in some way, and in that I learn from him
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.'  You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary
author: Winston Churchill

text: I believe there is no devil but fear
author: Elbert hubbard

text: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man
author: heraclitus

text: Do not be decieved, God cannot be mocked, for what you shall sow, you shall reap
author: Galatians 6:7

text: as courage is grace under pressure, so is gratitude grace under pleasure
author: unknown

text: It's not the mountain we conquer but ourselves
author: Sir Edmund Hillary

text: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself
author: Abraham Maslow

text: It isn't the view by which the climb is worth climbing, but the climb which makes the view worth viewing
author: unknown

text: When I became a man I put away childish things, including the fear of childishness and the desire to be very grown up
author: C.S lewis

text: What is inside must be defined before any truth of the outside can be determined
author: My brother

text: Be the inferior of no man, or of any men be superior. Remember that every man is a variation of yourself.
author: William Saroyan

text: To thine own self be true
author: William Shakespeare

text: Donâ€™t explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

text: A mathematician must have the courage to explore paths that lead nowhere, for even failure enriches understanding
author: Alexander Grothendieck

text: If there are phenomena, the reality of which we cannot deny but which cannot be fitted into our accepted conceptual framework, then something is wrong with that framework
author: G.I Gurdjieff
